definition: many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)
affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: "Financial markets are poor multi-taskers, " Woo writes.
sentences.chinese: “金融市場的多任務處理能力較差，”吳寫到。

sentences.english: This is a result of the quantized nature of time-shared multitasking.
sentences.chinese: 這是由分時多任務處理的量子化特性決定的。

sentences.english: In fact, the heavy multitaskers weren't even good at multitasking.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，他們還不如那些一般的多任務處理者。
